maml:description.maml:para: The Get-AzureRmRecoveryServicesBackupProperty cmdlet gets backup properties for a Recovery Services vault.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the vault. The vault must be an AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the vault. The vault must be an AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the backup vault property for vault.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of Recovery Services vaults.
The Get-AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault cmdlet gets a list of Recovery Services vaults in the current subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the vault to query for.
Specifies the name of the Azure resource group in which to create or from which to retrieve the specified Recovery Services object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the vault to query for.
Specifies the name of the Azure resource group in which to create or from which to retrieve the specified Recovery Services object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the list of vault in selected subscription.
Get the list of vault in resource group in selected subscription.
Get the vault in resource group with given name.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Azure Site Recovery vault settings file.
The Get-AzureRmRecoveryServicesVaultSettingsFile cmdlet gets the settings file for an Azure Site Recovery vault.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Azure Site Recovery vault object.
Specifies the path to the Azure Site Recovery vault settings file. You can download this file from the Azure Site Recovery vault portal and store it locally.
Indicates the vault credentials file is applicable to Azure Backup.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the Azure Site Recovery vault object.
Specifies the path to the Azure Site Recovery vault settings file. You can download this file from the Azure Site Recovery vault portal and store it locally.
Specifies the site friendly name. Use this parameter if you are downloading the vault credentials for a Hyper-V site.
Specifies the site identifier. Use this parameter if you are downloading the vault credentials for a Hyper-V site.
Indicates the vault credentials file is applicable to Azure Site Recovery.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the Azure Site Recovery vault object.
Specifies the path to the Azure Site Recovery vault settings file. You can download this file from the Azure Site Recovery vault portal and store it locally.
Indicates the vault credentials file is applicable to Azure Site Recovery.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Indicates the vault credentials file is applicable to Azure Backup.
Specifies the path to the Azure Site Recovery vault settings file. You can download this file from the Azure Site Recovery vault portal and store it locally.
Specifies the site friendly name. Use this parameter if you are downloading the vault credentials for a Hyper-V site.
Specifies the site identifier. Use this parameter if you are downloading the vault credentials for a Hyper-V site.
Indicates the vault credentials file is applicable to Azure Site Recovery.
Specifies the Azure Site Recovery vault object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.

maml:description.maml:para: Parameter 'Vault' accepts value of type 'ARSVault' from the pipeline

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Register a Windows Server or DPM machine for Azure Backup
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Vault01 = Get-AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault -Name "TestVault" PS C:\> $CredsPath = "C:\Downloads" PS C:\> $Credsfilename = Get-AzureRmRecoveryServicesVaultSettingsFile -Backup -Vault $Vault01 -Path $CredsPath

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the vault named TestVault, and then stores it in the $Vault01 variable.
The second command sets the $CredsPath variable to C:\Downloads.
The last command gets the vault credentials file for $Vault01 using the credentials in $CredsPath for Azure Backup.
The command gets the vault credentials file for $Vault01 of vault type siteRecovery.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Register a Windows Server or DPM machine for Azure Backup

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command gets the vault credentials file for $Vault01.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Recovery Services vault.
The New-AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault cmdlet creates a new Recovery Services vault.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the geographic location of the vault.
Specifies the name of the vault to create.
Specifies the name of the Azure resource group in which to create or from which to retrieve the specified Recovery Services object.

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.

Sets the properties for backup management.
The Set-AzureRmRecoveryServicesBackupProperties cmdlet sets backup storage properties for a Recovery Services vault.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the backup storage redundancy type.
Specifies the name of the vault. The vault must be an AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the backup storage redundancy type.
Specifies the name of the vault. The vault must be an AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.

maml:description.maml:para: Parameter 'Vault' accepts value of type 'ARSVault' from the pipeline

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set GeoRedundant storage for a vault
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Vault01 = Get-AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault -Name "TestVault" PS C:\> Set-AzureRmRecoveryServicesBackupProperties -Vault $Vault01 -BackupStorageRedundancy GeoRedundant

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the vault named TestVault, and then stores it in the $Vault01 variable.
The second command sets the backup storage redundancy for $Vault01 to GeoRedundant.

maml:description.maml:para: The Set-AzureRmRecoveryServicesVaultContext cmdlet sets the vault context for Azure Site Recovery services.

The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
